title: DATS dataset distribution schema
description: (From DCAT) Represents a specific available form of a dataset. Each dataset might be available in different forms, these forms might represent different formats of the dataset or different endpoints. Examples of distributions include a downloadable CSV file, an API or an RSS feed.

alternateIdentifiers.description: Alternate identifiers for the dataset distribution.

relatedIdentifiers.description: Related identifiers for the dataset distribution.

title.description: The name of the dataset, usually one sentece or short description of the dataset.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements describing the dataset distribution.

storedIn.description: The data repository hosting the dataset distribution.

dates.description: Relevant dates for the datasets, e.g. creation date or last modification date may be added.

version.description: A release point for the dataset when applicable.

licenses.description: The terms of use of the dataset distribution.

access.description: The information about access modality for the dataset distribution.

curationStatus.description: The level of curation of the dataset distribution.

conformsTo.description: A data standard whose requirements and constraints are met by the dataset.

qualifiers.description: One or more characteristics of the dataset distribution (e.g. how it relates to other distributions, if the data is raw or processed, compressed or encrypted).

formats.description: The technical format of the dataset distribution. Use the file extension or MIME type when possible. (Definition adapted from DataCite)

unit.description: The unit of measurement used to estimate the size of the dataset (e.g, petabyte). Ideally, the unit should be coming from a reference controlled terminology.

extraProperties.description: Extra properties that do not fit in the previous specified attributes.
